title: Talking Letters
content:
Dear Typophile Fans  
For my new English-Language-Teaching book, I need Talking letters like the “g” of our friend [Goran Soderstrom](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829162011/http:/typophile.com/user/11526)  
Many Thanks for any Link

 [‹ New Type ID Pop Quizzes](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829162011/http:/typophile.com/node/28065 "Go to previous forum topic") [Bibliophile's Wonders ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829162011/http:/typophile.com/node/28037 "Go to next forum topic")
author: AzizMostafa

comments.content:
Have you looked at [Bembo Zoo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829162011/http:/www.bembozoo.com/) for inspiration?

They can’t exactly “talk”, though. Would that work for your project?

Thanks Brampitoto, not so helpful as:  
 [http://www.kidcrosswords.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829162011/http:/www.kidcrosswords.com/ "http://www.kidcrosswords.com")  
Thank you once again.
Have you considered hiring someone drawing a couple for you? Someone with the.. er... right experience? ;-)

Goran, I fail to understand what you have posted.  
S...er..Storm? How much does he Charge for one letter?  
Sorry for my poor English.

Aziz. I’m also sorry for MY poor english :) I’m swedish.

No, I was just happy you mentioned my little running letter g.

Happy go Lucky!  
Keep Running with [Flowers](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829162011/http:/www.crauswords.com/flowers/WFlowers.htm)

See how the P [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829162011/http:/www.puzzability.com/index.shtml) made a talking word.

Any more?!
